properties.areaDesc: Cloud; Republic; Washington; Clay; Marshall; Ottawa
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 4:15AM CST until January 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Afternoon through
Saturday...

A strong storm system will approach the region late tonight into
Friday with rainfall overspreading much of northeast and east
central Kansas. Temperatures will rapidly fall during the
afternoon and evening hours Friday, transitioning precipitation
to a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet. All precipitation is
expected to transition to snow by sunrise Saturday morning, with
periods of moderate to heavy snow continuing through Saturday
afternoon.

* WHAT...Mainly snow expected with some sleet possible. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of
around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Kansas.

* WHEN...From noon today to noon CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could
impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two waves are expected from this system.
The first should bring mostly snow, but may bring a mix of snow,
sleet, and freezing rain to some areas this afternoon and
evening. There may be a lull overnight before the second wave
brings all snow to the area Saturday morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY
